metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23968 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If Content Security Policy blocked frame navigation, the full destination of a redirect served in the frame was reported in the violation report; as opposed to the original frame URI. This could be used to leak sensitive information contained in such URIs. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 86, Thunderbird < 78.8, and Firefox ESR < 78.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23968` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
